summary: This document is an email chain forwarded to the FBI regarding the USA v. Maxwell case. An individual named Mike Jones contacts a prosecutor, suggesting that Johan Eliasch may have ties to the underlying acts in the Maxwell case and offers to provide information.

persons.name: Mike Jones
persons.context: He emails a prosecutor handling the USA v. Maxwell case, claiming to have done work regarding Johan Eliasch and suggesting Eliasch may have ties to the case's underlying acts. He offers to provide a call.

persons.name: Johan Eliasch
persons.context: Mentioned by Mike Jones as a non-US citizen (Swedish, living in the UK) who may have ties to the underlying acts in the USA v. Maxwell case.

connections.description: Mike Jones claims to have been 'doing a lot of work with regards to Johan Eliasch' and believes Eliasch may have ties to the Maxwell case.
Mike Jones suggests Johan Eliasch 'may also have some ties to the underlying acts' in the USA v. Maxwell case, implying a potential connection to Ghislaine Maxwell's alleged activities.

events.title: Informant Email Regarding Johan Eliasch
events.description: Mike Jones sends an email to a prosecutor in the USA v. Maxwell case, suggesting Johan Eliasch may have ties to the case's underlying acts and offering to provide information.

keyFacts: An informant named Mike Jones contacts the prosecution in the USA v. Maxwell case in July 2020.
Mike Jones suggests Swedish businessman Johan Eliasch, living in the UK, may have ties to the underlying acts in the Maxwell case.
The email is forwarded through at least two parties before being sent to the FBI 'per our usual practice'.
The document shows the prosecution receiving unsolicited tips and information from the public regarding the Maxwell case.
